JOB.TITLE: Senior Scientist
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I lead NREL's scientific data visualization efforts in support of renewable energy research, collaborating with NREL domain scientists in the visualization of complex, large, multivariate data.

JOB.TITLE: Assistant Professor Adjunct for the Dept. of Computer Science
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I conduct research and oversee student research in scientific data visualization.

JOB.TITLE: Professional Research Assistant for CADSWES
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I worked in an interdisciplinary research center on the design and the development of a commercial graphically-based decision support software system implementing object-oriented simulation, rule-based simulation, and linear optimization to model watershed physical processes, water ownership, and policy.

JOB.TITLE: Professional Research Assistant for the Dept. of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I collaborated on the design and development of a pilot study to investigate the added value of using immersive visualization as a molecular research tool.

JOB.TITLE: Graduate Research Assistant for BP Center for Visualization
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I designed and developed an interactive 3D immersive application capable of integrating geological, geophysical, reservoir and well data with drilling and platform planning in an immersive virtual environment.

JOB.TITLE: Software Engineering Consultant/Research Scientist/Principal Software Engineer
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I authored SBIR and other new business proposals, developing and directing over $0.5M in grants and contracts. I also conducted software architecture and algorithm reviews for the Mars Odyssey and Genesis spacecraft programs.

JOB.TITLE: Visitor Appointment
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I collaborated on the design and development of VAPOR, a state-of-the-art volume visualization suite designed to interactively explore large-scale time-varying multivariate computational fluid dynamics (CFD) data.

JOB.TITLE: Senior Analyst/Medical Officer for US Antarctic Program, Raytheon Polar Services.
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I managed the data acquisition and visualization laboratory aboard the National Science Foundation's Antarctic research vessel, the Nathaniel B. Palmer, providing scientific support to NSF grantees. I also sailed as Medical Officer (EMT) aboard the Palmer.

JOB.TITLE: Technical Software Lead for Space and Science Systems, Raytheon Systems Corporation.
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I designed and developed animated meteorological visualization tools for the Cape Canaveral and Vandenberg space lift ranges that included the development of both real-time and analysis visualization algorithms and image processing software for radar and satellite instrumentation. As the technical lead I served as technical mentor, providing technical guidance across projects and organizations.

JOB.TITLE: Software Developer for Satellite Mission Management Organization, Hughes Space Systems
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I designed and developed a distributed satellite mission planning and scheduling software system that included interactive 2D computer graphic models of satellite and ground station resource allocation and 3D modeling tools used for satellite payload constraint analysis. I also helped design, develop, and maintain object-oriented class libraries designed for reuse and rapid development of satellite space and ground applications.

JOB.TITLE: Science and Engineering Research Intern for the Advanced Technology Division
JOB.RESPONSIBILITIES: I designed and developed interactive 2D visualizations of subsurface radioactive waste plumes created by a physically-based model of the breach, leach, and transport of radioactive waste material.
